intro: Anychia divaricata, commonly known as the variable anychia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and are arranged in clusters. Anychia divaricata is often found in shrubland and woodland habitats, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
